item.title: Software engineer (JavaScript, AngularJS) at TomTom (Edinburgh, UK)
item.description:
Developing new Sports products to make it even easier for you to achieve more’. George Sewell, TomTom


Where do you want to be?


We are looking for the best and brightest minds in Web Development. Someone who is truly passionate about creating beautiful innovative next generation UIs using bleeding edge technologies.


As a member of a SCRUM team, you are asked to deliver the following:



  1. Implement requirements from design mockups on the UI and integrate them with the backend services.

  2. Facilitate innovative design and find solutions to challenging technical problems through information gathering, ideation and best practices.

  3. Contribute to UI and UX solutions.

  4. Collaborate effectively with team members and product owners.


What do we expect from you?


There is no set route to become a Front-end Web Developer at TomTom but to be successful in this role, this is the kind of profile we have in mind:



  • 1-3 years of relevant experience with advance web development and applications.

  • Strong technical knowledge in current web development technologies including Javascript, AngularJS, CSS3, and HTML5.

  • You have solid understanding of MVC and ability to write clean, concise and maintainable code.

  • Keywords: AngularJS, Grunt, Karma, Protractor, Jasmine, Bootstrap, SASS, MomentJS, Bower, D3, SVG, test automation, responsive design.


What do we offer?



  1. The chance to work in a fast moving, innovative and international environment, dealing with all kind of different countries and cultures.

  2. Indefinite contract, 15% annual bonus, 25 annual leave days, pension scheme, life, medical and disability insurance, up to 50% discount on products.

  3. Among others, an online learning platform (1500 courses & 11000 e-books) as well as live speeches from software development gurus, like Uncle Bob.


Who are we?


TomTom empowers movement. Every day millions of people around the world depend on TomTom to make smarter decisions. We design and develop innovative products that make it easy for people to keep moving towards their goals.


Our map-based components include map content, online map-based services, real-time traffic, and navigation software. Our consumer products include PNDs, navigation apps, and GPS sports watches. Our main business products are custom in-dash navigation systems and a fleet management system, which is offered to fleet owners as an online service with integrated in-vehicle cellular devices.


Our business consists of four customer facing business units: Consumer, Automotive, Licensing and Telematics.


Founded in 1991 and headquartered in Amsterdam, we have 4,000 employees worldwide and sell our products in over 36 countries. For further information, please visit www.tomtom.com


Interested?


For the full story about the vacancy (ref 23124) or procedure, please click on www.tomtom.com/careers or contact Olga Bugheanu.


Online assessments and pre-employment screening are part of the selection process.

item.title: Full Stack Engineer at Prezi.com (Budapest, Hungary)
item.description:
We are looking for a Full Stack Web Developer, who is interested in building forward thinking web experiences and interactions to join our engineering team at Prezi. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with a growing start-up, building things millions of people will see everyday. This position is located in our Budapest office. 


You should be excited about:




  • Joining a team that focuses on the growth of the whole product.




  • Working in a small, cross functional team with other engineers, designers, data analysts, product managers.




  • Creating customer facing applications.




  • Deploy your changes several times a day and reach millions of people.




  • Working in a challenging, fast paced and always changing environment.




  • Contributing to a software which helps people present and share ideas in a new, easier way.





Challenges you will be working on:




  • Building new features, delivering value to our existing and future customers.




  • Creating responsive, performance driven user interfaces.




  • Designing, implementing and deploying scalable microservices to production as well as maintain existing web applications.




  • Run everything into the cloud (AWS), rethinking the assumptions that no longer hold in our current architecture.




  • Open source some of the awesome things we are working on.




  • Develop and maintain existing backend services (mostly written in Python) to ensure they are efficient, reliable and secure enough for our many million users.




  • You will play an important role in evolving the web presence for Prezi - a product that helps people share ideas. We have 60+ million users at the moment (and growing fast)!




  • Pro-actively enhancing our web platform

item.title: Tech Lead at Advisa (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
Advisa is now looking for a business-oriented and passionate Tech Lead who wants a leading role in a fast growing tech company operating in a transforming market. As Tech Lead you’ll have a significant influence on the company's product and work with cutting-edge technology to build the best customer experience within the industry.



As Advisa’s Tech Lead you will;



  • Have full responsibility for our software applications, technical platforms and IT infrastructure

  • On daily basis work hands-on with both front-end back-end development

  • Build and lead a team of software engineers

  • Set and improve work-flow processes

item.title: Developer .Net - Fintech, Old Street at Runpath (London, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for talented and enthusiastic Developers to join our team here at Runpath. 


As a member of our highly experienced technical team you will be helping to deliver cutting edge solutions for a variety of internal and external clients.  Specifically as a Developer, you’ll have a passion for building and shipping high performance, robust, and efficient solutions quickly. Ultimately we’re after someone who is flexible, a fast learner, loves to solve problems and enjoys getting products to market.  


About our Technology


Our technology stack of choice is AngularJS backed by client solutions and platform services all hosted on Azure built using the latest Microsoft .NET technologies: (MVC/Web API/Entity Framework/SQL Azure). We are a .NET shop, and like to utilise the latest technologies from ASP.Net and the community (within reason).  We are happy with specialisation, so you do not need to be an expert developer at all areas in the stack, but an exposure to and appreciation of the full stack is important.


Primary Responsibilities



  • Write efficient, bug free C# code for deployment to a high load environment

  • Work closely with the product development teams (designers, product/project managers, developers and business sponsors) to deliver solutions in an agile environment.

  • Be committed to the highest standard of work at all times.

  • As some projects are conducted at client sites, candidates must be happy to travel.


Core Competencies



  • C# ASP.NET/MVC/Web API

  • Javascript frameworks (eg AngularJS, Knockout, Ember, etc)

  • Entity Framework, SQL Server (SQL Azure a plus)

  • Test Driven Development


Preferred Qualities



  • Outstanding taste.  A passion for stunning and seamlessly functional user interfaces

  • Someone who loves getting things done

  • Excellent analytic and problem solving skills

  • Exceptional at collaborating with both technical and non technical people

  • Highly organised with a strong eye for detail

  • Good with feedback, continually looking to improve and develop

  • Sense of humour


Education and Job Knowledge



  • No specific academic qualifications required - all you need is the right experience, the right attitude and a really strong portfolio


About Us


Runpath (www.Runpath.com) is a fast growing, independent, London based, digital company.  We are passionate about delivering high quality products and outstanding digital experiences for our users.  We service clients including Compare The Market, GoCompare, Which?, Confused.com. Yahoo!, AOL, MSN, BT and many more.  Alongside Runpath sits our publishing portfolio which includes lovemoney.com and lovefood.com.   


Compensation


Salary dependent on experience. Benefits include 30 days holiday plus bank holidays, Life, PHI and BUPA private health insurances, bike scheme and travel loan plus many more.  All benefits are available from first day of employment.


To Apply


Please submit your application including up to date CV, detailed cover letter along with examples and links to your recent work.


Recruitment Agencies – Runpath recruits directly.  Runpath does not accept unsolicited CVs from agencies and is not responsible for any associated fees.


This position is based in Central London. All candidates must be eligible to work in the UK to be considered.


No terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of race, disability, sex or age, and we confirm that we will gladly accept applications from any persons for this role.

item.title: Web Software Developer (m/f) at bwin.party digital entertainment (Wien, Austria)
item.description:
You are a JavaScript ninja, but can work in .Net just as well. Your world is TDD, SPA, MVC and OOP. You have several years of working experience, or have just finished your studies and consider yourself a rock star. You are creative and innovative and do not take things for granted. You know that every specification can be improved. You know how to make application “fly” and understand what “mobile first” means. You are not afraid of big data and a large number of concurrent users.


We have some amazing projects to offer. You’ll build frontend web applications with us, for our sports betting products optimized for mobile and desktop clients. Our stack is built with AngularJS on top of an C# MVC application. We live in sprints and count in story points.


Interested? Please keep reading.


Your arena:



  • Agile Software design and development of high-quality and high-traffic web applications

  • Requirements engineering

  • Support and consult product ideas from a technical perspective

  • Collaborate with others to launch and operate software in production

  • Troubleshoot and investigate problems and incidents


Our bet:



  • Dynamic international environment

  • Enough power, memory and SSD storage for all your needs

  • Coffee, tea, table soccer and spaces to chill out

  • Perfect location in the heart of the city

item.title: Back-end/architect developer at Advisa (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
Advisa is looking for a driven and analytical Back-end/architect developer who wants a key role in a fast growing tech company operating in a transforming market. As a Back-end/architect developer you’ll have a significant influence on the company's technical platforms and work with cutting-edge technology to build applications that will be used by hundreds of thousands of customers.


As Back-end/architect developer you’ll;



  • Work in close collaboration with our business development department to build a scalable system that will help hundreds of thousands Swedes to lower their interest rates

  • Together with a dedicated team of highly skilled developers be responsible of maintaining and developing all parts of a complex service-oriented system

  • Set the direction and do the implementation of our future architecture  

  • Work with a large arsenal of open source and cutting-edge technologies such as Node.js, Angular.js, MySQL, Docker, RabbitMQ and Redis.

item.title: Problem solving ruby & front end devs: Toronto, Southampton, Portugal, London at Alliants (Southampton, UK)
item.description:
We’re looking for value focussed, problem solvers to join our development team. People who are excited about technology and how it can be used to help businesses.


Us


Alliants is a fast-growing technology consultancy and development company; based on the south coast of England with locations in London, Toronto and Coimbra. We advise companies (new and established, big and small) on their technical strategy, coach them on how to deliver effectively and develop software solutions to their business problems.


All of our work comes from recommendation and therefore we look for people who have pride in what they do. We’re a knowledge based business - people come to us because we know what to do and how to do it. Therefore we don’t hire people to just write programs, we hire people to provide solutions.


We currently predominantly use Rails and Angular for web, Swift & Java for mobile, but we adapt as necessary and are  always interested in other technologies.


You


You always look to provide the best solution to business problems and ensure that what you are doing is providing value. You’re not happy just to be told what to build; you want to know why. 


You understand and have experience of robust development frameworks including source control, unit testing and daily builds. Industry best practices such as TDD and pair programming are just what you do.


You enjoy learning and experiment with new technologies, languages and libraries outside of your day job. Open source projects which can demonstrate your skills will be highly regarded.


Of course technical competency is important but we want people passionate about software. We think that passion is visible in our work and want it to be visible in you too.


Good Stuff



  • All developers get personal development time to explore new things

  • You will have an annual training budget to enable you to learn and develop

  • We provide and sponsor coding clubs and hack days

  • Choose your hardware (we’re typically a MacBook crowd)

  • Fridays are awesome; bacon sandwiches (or equivalent), free lunch and beer

  • Top line benefits; pension, healthcare, bonuses, child care vouchers, cycle to work etc…



We are looking for people of all levels, from recent graduates to senior developers. If you think we’d get on then get in touch.

item.title: JavaScript Developer at Betsson Group (Ta' Xbiex, Malta)
item.description:
Intrigued by building business-focused software with modern techniques? Passionate about coding? Then this might just be the opportunity you are looking for! We’re currently seeking Javascript Developers to join our Front End team in Malta!


You will be part of a truly agile team, focused on building customer facing web sites that are visited by thousands of users every day. With over 80 frontend developers and QAs spread over 3 locations, Betsson aims at delivering the best user experience in the industry. Each frontend team works on multiple products, including sportsbook, casino, poker as well as their mobile-web counterpart!  We’re a growing team looking for developers of all levels so it doesn’t matter whether you’re a newbie, an established developer or a code veteran.


Responsibilities


As a Javascript Developer you will be responsible for software development in a scrum team using light-weight agile processes. You will be contributing directly to the success of our brands by materializing our business teams’ visions into a tangible user experience. You will participate in sprint planning, task estimation, development, testing, code reviews, bug fixing, deploying great software, implementing new features as well as maintaining and improving the existing functionality.

item.title: Web-Entwickler (m/w) mit Java EE at adorsys GmbH & Co. KG (Nürnberg, Deutschland)

Wer sind wir?


Wir sind kunterbunte Talente, die Wissen nicht als ihr Eigentum betrachten, sondern dieses am liebsten mit anderen teilen.

item.title: Ruby on Rails developer in Amsterdam Area at YoungCapital (Hoofddorp, Netherlands)
item.description:
We are looking for talented and enthusiastic Ruby programmers. Our development team works on diverse projects, from our job opening listings to financial planning systems. Our software is used both internally and externally and our feedback loop short and direct.


As a Ruby developer you will be ensuring that 45,000 students get the jobs they want and the salaries they strive for. Our software hosts over 3 million candidates from all over Europe. We are agile, work in sprints and do stand-ups every day. This gives you and your colleagues the feedback to continuously improve code quality and process. Being agile means that you can be flexible and work on diverse projects such as the improvement of our job opening sites, planning systems, payroll software and e-learning applications.


As a Ruby developer you will be responsible for the development of systems that are being used to annually get more than 45.000 students the jobs they want and the salary they consequently get. Our database hosts over 3 million candidates from many different countries, which makes this a very challenging task.  We scrum our performance every twee weeks, which means you’ll be working at a variety of projects. For example, the improvement of our vacancy sites, incentives software, planning systems, invoicing software and E-learning applications. Because we use all our software within the company, you’ll instantly see how your code gets put into practice. This in turn, gives us direct feedback to improve your coding which is very exciting!


All applications are home made. To do this, we use the web application framework Ruby on Rails.
Besides that, we use Git, ElasticSearch, Sidekiq with Redis, MySQL, Nginx, Unicorn and Chef.

item.title: Software Developer JavaScript Web Components for Amazon Web Services Berlin (m/f) at Amazon (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for an experienced JavaScript developer to build a framework of UI components that improve our customer experience and make our developers happy.



Amazon Web Services offers a broad set of global compute, storage, database, analytics, application, and deployment services that help organizations move faster, lower IT costs, and scale applications. Every day, our customers interact with a large number of single-page applications to manage their cloud-infrastructure.



Build performant and highly reusable UI components with us, to ensure a great user experience across all these different offerings.



If you have a passion for how web applications should be built, are always interested in upcoming web standards, care about making other developers’ lives better, want to work with world-class engineers to solve hard problems, we'd love to talk to you!



You will work highly customer-focused and be given the time to learn and experiment with the latest frontend technologies.



You will be part of a SCRUM team that delivers well-tested and reviewed releases.



You will innovate and simplify the process of creating interfaces for all Amazon Web Services.



In close collaboration with project teams around the globe you have the chance to redefine the development process for modern web-based applications.



Our team is located in Berlin and Seattle.


  • Development experience in larger projects

  • In-depth knowledge of different JS frameworks (e.g. AngularJS, React, GWT, Ember.js)

  • An eye for clean, testable, maintainable, and performant code

  • Interest in the latest frontend technology, e.g. Web Components

  • Great communication skills



We are looking for software developer with experience building large scale software and application architecture, therefore knowledge of another language such as Ruby, Python, Go or Java is preferred.




  • Experience with Web Components and other upcoming W3C standards

  • Experience with cross-platform / device development

  • Contribution to Open Source projects

  • Github repos and/or a proven interest in the mentioned areas are a big plus


As a lot of the technologies we use are rather new and partially experimental you should provide links to relevant repositories or writings if you have contributed to these projects or have explored them in depth.

item.title: Full-stack JavaScript Developer at pebble {code} (London, UK)
item.description:
Fed up with feeling like a tiny cog in a huge machine? Bored with the strict work practices, outmoded coding standards and draconian time management? By joining a small company, you are guaranteed to be a key a part of our team from day one.


pebble {code} is passionate about crafting outstanding software. We are signatories to the Software Craftsmanship Manifesto and believe in contributing to, not just consuming open source projects. We are advocates of continuous integration and won’t be shy if you ask about our test coverage. 


There are opportunities for JavaScript developers to work on full-stack applications for Blue Chip clients and startups. You will be working with UX and UI designers and will become part of a growing JavaScript team. We foster developer empowerment and keep management layers and meetings to a minimum. We believe in hacking and experimentation over lengthy discussions. 


Candidates should be self starters, not afraid to ask when they don’t know, and capable of managing their own time. You will be working as part of a small team, at times working directly with another programmer using a single computer, so you must be comfortable working in this kind of environment.


Remuneration: Competitive.

item.title: Lead Software Engineer at rapidly growing startup at Iamb&b (Amsterdam, Netherlands) (allows remote)
item.description:
Your job will be working shoulder to shoulder with the CTO spec'ing out, road mapping and building the platform and also working with and leading our team of freelancers. We are a tech driven company and you will be working with state of the art technology to keep us in the game. The role gives a lot of freedom and responsibility, you’ll be making key decisions from day one. 



  • Work from our amazing office at Kerkstraat 61 in the center of Amsterdam.

  • Be part of a small but amazing team where you will be behind the steering wheel making key decisions from day one.

  • Competitive salary

  • Possibility to work remote

  • Office lunch

item.title: Principal Java Developer at Auto Trader UK (Manchester, UK)
item.description:
Our developers have the freedom to take control of providing a beautiful experience for our customers. We love agile and work in small squads to ensure each squad has a focus and a mission. This way we ensure every squad member counts, has a voice, shares ideas and is involved from the moment they join. 


So how much do you know about AutoTrader? Did you know that we’re the largest digital automotive marketplace in the UK with over 15 million monthly users carrying out over 159 million searches among over 475 000 new and used vehicles? With the closure of the print business in 2013, we’ve successfully transferred our print classified car advertising business online; now 69% of all visits to Auto Trader are done using a mobile device. We deliver great products to our customers and we want to remain number 1 in the market.


We use test driven / continuous delivery practices to build RESTful JSON web services and web applications using Java. We make sure our systems can scale to meet the demands of a high traffic website as we receive millions of visits a day. We really care about how performance impacts our customers. We are looking for people with a deep interest in technology who are comfortable finding and adopting new technical approaches all the way from the browser to the database-it's a fast moving market so we have engaged and responsible self organising teams.

item.title: Full Stack Ruby on Rails Developer at Wishpond (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
Full stack developer to work on self-serve marketing tools.


We have several tools and follow the SOA architecture throughout our many features. We have several applications with a limited feature set so we can easily swap out a piece for another if it becomes a bottleneck.


Most of our applications are on the latest version of rails and we work hard to keep it that way. Rails is our API layer and all new development is done in AngularJS.


We use Github and do the branch-per-feature workflow with code reviews on each pull request.


This posting is for local work only. No remote work.

item.title: AngularJS + NodeJS Engineer - $15/hr, 100% remote position at Crossover (Guadalajara, Mexico) (allows remote)
item.description:
Ready to make $30,000 USD while working for a fortune 500 company from the comfort of your home? Eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? Do you have extensive experience with structural frameworks for dynamic web apps and open-source, cross-platform runtime environments for developing server-side web applications? If so, this role is for you. Work for Crossover, and youll earn the most competitive wages on the market, collaborate with the most skilled teams in your field, and work for the most elite companies in the world. Sound too good to be true? Take a closer look


What to Expect as an AngularJS and NodeJS Engineer at Crossover

Join Crossover and youll be given the responsibility of engineering backend services with supporting front end UIs for enterprise consumption in a cloud stack. You will assist a global team of web designers and developers in utilizing the best-in-practice architecture, tools, and design patterns in web development. You will be expected to think in an abstract or computational way to provide solutions to help scalability and handle complex business logic. Creativity in solution implementations are welcomed!

item.title: Front-End Javascript / AngularJS Developer at Rebel Minds (London, UK)

We're looking for front-end developers who love building things in HTML, CSS and Javascript. You'll work closely with our design and back-end teams creating beautiful and powerful products for both small and enterprise projects.

We make digital products for clients, including mobile applications, back-end enterprise platforms and sexy consumer-facing websites.


Alongside longer-term partners, we also work on smaller 1-6 week projects and these are typically handled by one or two people.

You should be a good communicator and be as open to working in a team as working alone. We're a very agile and fast-paced team with complimenting skill-sets, and you should be open to helping others and expanding your skills.


We focus on raw talent and aren't too concerned about lots of work or education history for this role, but we would like to see some code you've written and your work. 


No recruiters please.

item.description:
As a senior front-end developer you will work with UX strategists, designers and back-end developers to understand the project needs and requirements, translate these into new and improved web experience solutions, and collaborate with designers and developers to bring your ideas to life.


You'll have the opportunity to build and shape some of the most exciting and popular sites. ORM works with clients such as First Great Western, Aviva, Spirit Pub Group, Channel 4 and National Rail Enquiries.

item.title: Senior Frontend Developer at esanum GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are searching for Senior Frontend developer to improve our platform. esanum is one of the leading communities for physicians worldwide. Currently, we provide services for more than 70k physicians, with an increasing tendency.


Your Personality


You will take ownership for new and existing features in a Microservice-driven environment. You’re aware of clean code principles and will regularly refactor existing features if you see need. As you’re a smart developer, you’ll always be able to differentiate between the important and the non- important things (YAGNI) and you are generally able to carry responsibility for yourself and others. You’re quality-driven and are able to think Product-centric. You’re not a fantastic superhero but a solid team-player.


Our Culture


You’ll join an open and enthusiastic Engineering team. We’re having an atmosphere of open technical discussions and agree to the best solutions we come up with. We always try to avoid overly complex enterprise-y solutions if we don’t really need them. We’re regularly having an open eye on developments in the communities and apply them if we see them fit our use-cases.


Our Platform


esanum is a world-wide platform for physicians. Therefore, we’re fostering a Distributed System, currently deployed to Latin America and Europe. Our architecture consists of a set of Microservices that join forces to provide our feature set. The Web interfaces are AngularJS-driven Single Page Apps sharing a common SDK and SASS-based Style Kit. Our cloud infrastructure uses Docker to automatically build and deploy new versions that can be shipped to production in no time. Our stack guarantees developer happiness and rapid time-to-market.


Sounds interesting? Then don’t hesitate to send your job application to karriere@esanum.de.


Beware: What you currently see on esanum.de (or esanum.fr, esanum.it, esanum.com.co etc.) is NOT what we are developing at the moment. This is 7 years old and we are getting rid of it as we speak.

item.title: Frontend Developer (m/w) at hydra newmedia GmbH (Stuttgart, Deutschland)
item.description:
Frontend Developer (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
Wir suchen einen engagierten Frontend Developer, der mit uns moderne und leistungsstarke Web-Apps mit AngularJS entwickelt. Wenn du ein Problemlöser bist, kopfstark und sympathisch-pragmatisch, dann passt das gut zu uns. Und wenn du so wie wir Spaß daran hast, cutting edge Anwendungen für Millionen von Menschen zu entwickeln, umso besser. Bei hydra newmedia erstellst du mit Hilfe der neuesten Technologien und in enger Zusammenarbeit mit den Backend- und Frontendteams dynamische Anwendungen und Produkte.

Was dich ausmacht:



  • HTML, CSS und JavaScript sind dein täglich Brot

  • Du bist stolz darauf, hervorragende Arbeit zu liefern

  • Du bist erfahren in der objektorientierten Programmierung

  • Du willst dich an Open-Source-Projekten beteiligen und kennst bereits git und Github

  • Du hast bereits diverse REST APIs und AJAX erfolgreich genutzt

  • Frameworks wie jQuery hast du bereits produktiv eingesetzt

  • Du hast Erfahrungen mit MVC Design-Patterns und/oder Frameworks wie BackboneJS und AngularJS

  • Build Tools wie Gulp/Grunt und Preprocessors wie SASS/LESS sind dir nicht fremd

  • Du liebst es, immer die besten neuen Technologien in die Finger zu bekommen und deinen Horizont zu erweitern

  • Du bist ein Teamplayer

  • Du hast ein Auge für gutes Design & UI

  • Du sprichst fließend Deutsch und hast gute Englisch-Kenntnisse


Könntest du damit gemeint sein? Dann würden wir gerne von dir hören! Im Idealfall…



  • bist du außerdem gut darin, deinen Web-Apps mit PHP ein serverseitiges Rückgrat zu verpassen

  • bist du heiß darauf, in unserem Büro Tischkicker, Tischtennis oder Wii U Spiele wie Mario Kart 8 zu spielen


Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung, ganz unabhängig von deiner bisherigen Berufserfahrung. Sollten die oben genannten Punkte nicht komplett auf dich zutreffen, dann melde dich trotzdem und lass uns wissen, weshalb du der Richtige für uns bist.


Wir freuen uns, bald von dir zu hören!


Viele Grüße,
Frank


jobs@hydra-newmedia.com

item.title: JavaScript Developer at dotmailer (Croydon, UK)
item.description:
Come and join us as a lead JavaScript Developer in our East Croydon office!


dotMailer is a SaaS automated marketing platform. We provide a suite of powerful tools which allow marketing companies to promote their businesses online. Over the past 15 years we've been growing fast and our systems now cater for thousands of users and terabytes of data. We have a team of front-end developers who love building rich and intuitive interfaces and we want our users to carry out complex tasks without specialist skills or training.


Our company and product is growing fast and we want to expand our development team to match. We work in small teams following an Agile methodology, and you'll be an active team member helping us build killer features and solve problems of scale. We work in a great office and don't take ourselves too seriously. We love technology and our codebase is ours to look after for the long-haul. We want you to build good quality maintainable software to be proud of.


We've written our own JavaScript libraries and make good use of AngularJS. We also use the ubiquitous jQuery, and Raphael for some cool flow-diagram building stuff. However we're always looking at the latest frameworks to see how they could help. We actively encourage you to learn new skills and we hope you'll take part in our lunch & learn sessions - free food and training!


We’re headquartered on the 20th floor of Croydon's most iconic building; "Number One Croydon" we are right next to the mainline station, 8 minutes from Clapham Junction, 14 from London Bridge, 16 from Victoria and 45 from Brighton! As part of our continued growth, we have expanded our operations across the UK, Eastern Europe and the USA with offices in Manchester, Edinburgh, Cambridge, Minsk & New York.

Join our A-team in Germany’s startup capital of Europe or in Hamburg with its alluring harbour and fresh air, if:



  • you’re on the cutting edge of technology

  • JavaScript in combination with HTML5 and CSS3 is what you love to build powerful user interfaces

  • AngularJS is the framework of your choice

  • you realise an awesome REST API if you see one

  • you are familiar with so-called modern development processes like Scrum, CI, TDD and the corresponding tools

  • your code fits the language and framework conventions, is smart, extendable and maintainable

  • you’re not scratching your head to remember basic Git commands

  • your English is good enough to read, write and discuss tasks within an international team


You will:

  • become responsible as lead ui-dev for multiple projects in various areas

  • deal with great REST APIs and smart backend developers all day long

  • gain reputation and satisfaction

If interested, send an email to Martin Rudloff (jobs@etventure.com).

We develop our solutions within a SCRUM process. We use C# to build micro services, HTML5, CSS, AngularJS and JavaScript to provide a rich UI. The platform is based on the Microsoft Azure cloud platform utilising their scalable architecture for SQL as well as the new DocumentDB JSON database.

item.title: Web Wizard at DEEP IMPACT AG (Winterthur, Switzerland)
item.description:
What’s the deal? 
Web software creation! As a member of our developer team, you can get involved on any level and in any area we are working on: brainstorming, architecture, development, testing, integration, delivery, and operations. What you end up doing depends as much on you as on us. We want you to be free to develop your skills precisely where your passions lie.


What are our methods, languages, technologies, etc?
You’re not going to find a lot of dogma at DEEP IMPACT: we have completely agile projects, and projects that may remind you of waterfall. We use statically and dynamically typed as well as compiled and interpreted languages. We run quite a few databases (SQL or No), and don’t limit ourselves to a single framework. We strike a balance between the introduction rate of new and shiny vs. the need to maintain a stable and productive ecosystem which is clearly biased toward the new and shiny. Here are a couple of keywords to give you an idea of what we currently use: AngularJS, React Flux (Alt), SCSS/Less, Foundation, JVM, Java, Clojure, PHP, DDD, CQRS, Spring, Zend, Pimcore, Play, Akka, Jetty, MySQL, Cassandra, MongoDB, TitanDB, Datomic. Currently TypeScript, ClojureScript and PostgreSQL are candidates for the list.

item.title: Frontend UI/UX Software/Web Developer (Javascript & Angular) at Pasker (Manchester, UK)

About the role


You will be joining a small but growing start-up software company, primarily working on the product development of an innovative new SaaS Platform for building Enterprise Systems. Your focus will be on creating an engaging and elegant User Interface for all products within the suite, for products that are used by technical and non-technical users. Work will be high paced, engaging and full of opportunity. There will be plenty of collaborative design work, and flexibility in the work hours and location. The role is part creative and part technical and very user focused - this means you will need to be able to handle the various modern web technologies, adapt as the technical architecture develops and throughout ensure the user experience is simple, effective and engaging.


This is a full time, permanent role in a start-up software company where you'll be helping build some very innovative and advanced software that will be technically interesting and very likely stretch your abilities. We are working with a lot of modern technologies and techniques, with leading edge architecture and product vision. You have a lot of opportunity to influence the technical direction and make a name for yourself in the industry, and there's considerable opportunity for you to develop your career as the company grows.


We want you to be a part of our core team, to be with us on the journey building the world's most advanced Enterprise Systems Platform. You will have the opportunity to take on a lead position as we grow the team if you desire, and we will support your career development as if it were our own.


If you are an established UI Developer that wants to work on interesting and challenging problems, have a passion for creating high quality work, and want to be in on the ground floor of a start-up, this is the role for you.


Depending on experience the job offers up to £45k per year + bonus.


What you'll be doing



  1. Standards Compliant Web Design and Development

  2. Some creative design of the User Interfaces

  3. User Experience Design

  4. Technical Design of Web Based User Interfaces

  5. Development of Web Based User Interfaces

  6. Involvement in Technology Selection

  7. UI Test Script Development

  8. Test and QA

  9. Support and Knowledge Sharing

  10. Potentially some Consulting

Focus on Data Visualization.  After Action collects opinion / subjective data from players and coaches.  As After Action has expanded features, the amount of data has been growing exponentially.  We are looking for someone with experience designing and displaying websites that are simultaneously attractive, interactive and able to show large amounts of visualized data.

item.title: AngularJS / MEAN-stack Engineer / UX Engineer at Stratagem Technologies Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
Stratagem Technologies is an established sports betting technology startup looking for an innovative AngularJS or MEAN-stack Engineer with an emphasis in User Interface design / data visualization.


The job will involve continued development of our sports betting analysis and execution cloud platform StrataBet. StrataBet is a one-stop portal for all things sports betting, and currently has professional analysis, models, and execution capabilities for football with Tennis in development. Our stack involves a static AngularJS frontend and Golang API backends. (Golang can be learned upon hire.)  We use various databases including Cassandra, mongodb, Redis and message queue RabbitMQ. You will ideally have experience developing web platforms using AngularJS with a particular emphasis on UX design and data visualization. Some experience with big data ideal but not required.


The StrataBet platform is at the core of what we at Stratagem work with and is integral to our company. We are a growing and innovative technology company at the intersection of finance and sports betting. You will be smart and able to get stuff done, but you'll also want to contribute ideas and expand horizons.


We don't score 12 on the Joel Test right now, but we aspire to, and we want to find someone who will help us move in that direction. Joining a startup, this is your chance to get in early and make your mark. You'll have autonomy to make decisions and to work how you want to work, allowing you to deliver results as efficiently as possible. Want to explore new technologies? No Problem. Want to learn new skills? Even Better. We want you to be hungry to push the horizons ­ both ours and yours.

item.title: Software Developer at Sortable (Kitchener, ON, Canada)
item.description:
We are looking for generalist programmers who like to take charge of large feature areas and drive them to completion. We hire people with strong technical backgrounds, but who also possess the soft skills to manage non-technical parts of problems. We like to prototype and deploy quickly to test ideas, and determining what to build is at least as important as the algorithms and data structures we use to build it. 


Tools of the Trade



The Work


 There are two parts to our business: Sortable Ads and Sortable Products.


Sortable Ads helps web publishers monetize their website with minimal effort so they can focus on doing what they do best: creating great content. Challenges we work on this area include crawling and rendering pages on the web at scale, analyzing enormous volumes of data to set efficient price floors and building intuitive self-serve user interfaces for our publishers.


Sortable Products covers our product recommendation sites (e.g., Snapsort.com), which help consumers quickly make informed decisions on which product to purchase. Challenges in this area include developing algorithms and UI to boil many data points down to simple conclusions, crawling the web to collect data, and building automated quality control systems.

item.title: Web Developer at Futurice GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Futurice is an international Lean Service Creation company with offices in Helsinki, Berlin, Munich, London, Stockholm and Tampere. We design and implement digital services for clients from a range of industries, such as telecommunication, media, OEM and automotive. Futurice was founded in 2000 with a mission: to develop top-notch software with happy people, happy customers and happy users. Our most important asset: a passionate bunch of cross-discipline developers, consultants and service designers. Our tool of choice: Lean Service Creation, which combines the best workflows from agile software development and service design. Our goal: to make the world a better place with great digital services.






Are you are a passionate web developer who wants to have an impact on people's lives, loves fresh challenges and enjoys life on the edge? Are you tired of not being challenged in your work, or not being able to learn from working with skilled colleagues? You should get in touch!


What awaits you:



  • Concepting digital services in an interdisciplinary team, together with our clients from various industries

  • Development of a wide variety of web applications

  • Sharing experiences and learnings with your colleagues

  • Constant learning and self-improvement through conferences and team events

  • Flat hierarchies and the opportunity to make your voice heard


What we expect:



  • A strong background in front-end development (Javascript, CSS, HTML)

  • A clear understanding of configuring build systems (Grunt/Gulp)

  • The passion and skill required to build and ship high-quality software

  • Interest in other platforms and technologies, as well as future trends

  • Experience with established frameworks (Angular.js, Backbone)

  • Reactive frameworks and modern architectures (MVP/MVC/MVVM) is a plus

  • The ability to discuss project work with our customers, over phone, video conference, or at our or their premises.

  • Some travelling will be required.


For a senior role, you should also have:



  • Experience with CI and Continuous deployment (AWS, Docker, etc)

  • Experience with unit testing frameworks

  • Some experience developing backend technologies


You are able to communicate fluently in English, our company language. German skills are beneficial, but not required. You should have a passion for learning and the talent to quickly grasp new concepts and technologies.


What we offer you:


We are a team of enthusiastic and ambitious people from a dozen different countries that aim to create a caring and inclusive workplace. We love Berlin for its thriving tech scene, and the many possibilities to meet like-minded people. If you want to experience other cities you also have the opportunity to work at our other sites, e.g. London or Helsinki, through client projects or our FutuHike programme. Futurice also offers sponsorships for open source contributions that you do in your free time. And since you know best what tools you need, you get to pick your work laptop, smartphone, tablet or smartwatch.


Join us and become part of an international, highly transparent company culture with lots of exciting career opportunities!


Please send your application to careers.germany@futurice.com.





www.futurice.com

item.title: Web Crawling Frontend Developer at Bloomberg LP (Princeton, NJ)

item.title: Backend Engineer - Python, Java, .NET, CoffeeScript, Elastic Search, AWS at Skyscanner (Glasgow, UK)
item.description:
Our Backend Engineers are the backbone of our business. They build the engines that power Skyscanner. Platforms that can cope with the millions of user visits every day. We’re always looking for exceptional engineers to join them. We need those with proven experience of building web services using a range of internet technologies. Robust, scaleable solutions that you’re prepared to hang your reputation on.


If your engineering ability isn’t up for debate, but your approach is always up for discussion, apply today.


You can offer us:


A hunger to learn, a desire to meet challenges, a passion for technology and development. Experience in scaleable web architecture, web technologies and Agile practices.


We can offer you:


An excellent career move.


A space within an autonomous Agile squad.


The space to be trusted to do what you do best. And to make decisions that matter.


The potential to build big things.


The thrill of writing great code and seeing it go live.


The opportunity to build something that millions of people see and use every day.

item.title: Senior Frontend Engineer at Falcon Social (Copenhagen, Denmark)
item.description:
Falcon Social is a Software-as-a-Service provider in the Social Media Management space. We provide a unified approach for marketers, customer service specialists and hr personnel of big international brands to manage their social media presence. That means plenty of challenging engineering tasks, complex UIs to simplify and data, loads of data.


We are looking for senior members for our engineering team. You are joining an ambitious team of experts who keep pushing the limit in product delivery and experiment furiously, while striving for technical excellence.


We are agile, organized ourselves into cross-functional, autonomous teams, focusing on one product with a clear mission. We intend to be flat, with everyone equal and with each member's role respected. Day-to-day you will work together with people of different trades: frontend, backend engineers, ui/ux designers, cloud operation engineers, and product owners.


We are a maturing startup with an engineering headcount of 20. We are not small anymore, and still growing rapidly. Working at a startup is the most rewarding choice what one can make, but it requires a certain personality as well. That being said, we value open people who take initiative more than lone rockstars.


Falcon Social’s frontend is a single page web application built with AngularJs, Require.js, Bower, Grunt, D3.js on top of a REST flavored HTTP+JSON api served by a lighthweight Java8 backend running on DropWizzard, PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, AWS, Apache Spark and Python.


Extensive experience with a modern MVC Javascript framework (Ember, Angular, Knockout) is a must for this position.

item.title: C# Developers building geospatial data and visualisation software at Landmark Information Group (Exeter, UK)
item.description:
We’re looking for enthusiastic and talented Developers to join the Product Development team of our market leading geospatial data and visualisation products. This will support one of our defined business units which boasts significant growth plans, based from our Exeter office. Our wide range of products provide digital mapping, site-specific environmental risk information and solutions to the property industry.


You will be part of a vibrant and ambitious team who are making a real difference to our business by designing and delivering first class software in an environment of dynamic and outcome focused delivery. Our objectives are technically challenging and we deliver products which generate a key part of the business’ revenue. Are you looking for a challenge that will push your boundaries in terms of your personal development, and help contribute to business success through developing innovative products for our customers? If so, we’d love to hear from you.


Our developers have an important voice in how our products are constructed, so an open and collaborative approach to change is essential. Our teams have great opportunities for personal development and therefore the role would benefit a self-motivated learner.

item.title: Front end engineer at urban farming startup at Evogro (East Malling, UK)
item.description:
Evogro make indoor plant growing systems for chefs. Having just completed a successful crowdfunding round on Crowdcube, we plan to disrupt the fresh produce supply chain by conquering the commercial market before expanding our products into the home. Our growing cabinets use the latest hydroponics and LED lighting and are backed by our cloud infrastructure, dealing with sensor and image data and using clever algorithms to control the cabinets over the internet.


You are a talented front end developer that wants to join the Evogro team based in East Malling, near Maidstone in Kent. You have solid experience designing and implementing web-based applications. You’ll have an eye for design and be obsessed with detail. You’ll be responsible for making sure that Evogro’s customers have an awesome user experience, and the customer support team can get their jobs done efficiently.


Working directly with the CTO and CEO, you will take ownership and be proud of your work and you will be highly encouraged to share your ideas and contribute to Evogro’s strategy. You will have the freedom to choose your own direction in terms of implementation for new projects, but you’ll be equally at home maintaining and enhancing existing code.

item.title: Full Stack Developer - $30/hr, 100% remote position at Crossover (Istanbul, Turkey) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are mobi. And we’re looking for some more awesome devs to help us grow our team. Here’s a little about our team, if you think you’d be a good fit, apply using the link below!

The Company

mobi is not only headquartered in the fastest growing technology center in the United States, but also literally at the center of it all in Austin, Texas at 7th and Congress.

We code systems that crunch large streams of real-time GPS data by wielding complex geo-location algorithms. Some call it big data, we call it Monday. Our front-end code serves up this data in an easy-as-pie, business-friendly view. We crunch it, and we serve it. mobi provides an end-to-end solution that helps companies plan work, optimize routes, visualize GPS data and analyze the results. We’re innovating here – but we can’t tell you about it, until at least our second date.

The Role

Our team is all about getting s#!t done. We are pragmatic problem solvers who pull from a diverse technology tool set.

  • Write killer code in many languages – solid and robust
  • Test before, during, and after – TDD on steroids
  • Core tech stack is JVM/Java/Groovy, JS/AngularJS and SQL
  • Thirst and passion for raising the bar and making it better than it is now
  • Social team players in a real open space environment with music and significant shenanigans
  • Have a large tool box: Clojure (functional paradigms), Ruby/Chef/DevOps, Sinatra/Rails, hardcore shell scripting, high performance C++ engines, SQL datamarts, sproc-ing and data pumping; you must have enough tools to use the right one for the job
  • We are real-deal Agile: good design, heavy testing, continuous delivery, pair programming in an open space environment, and lots of communication
  • Embrace the inner, twisted technologist – hackathons, side projects, open source
  • Enjoy ping pong, nerf bullets, and long walks on the beach ;)

item.title: Senior Front End Developer - $60K, 100% remote position at Crossover (Moscow, Russia) (allows remote)
item.description:
Ready to make $60,000 USD and eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you. Work for Crossover, and you’ll earn the most competitive wages on the market, collaborate with the most skilled teams in your field, and work for the most elite companies in the world. Sound too good to be true? Take a closer look...

What to Expect as a Senior Front-end Web Developer at Crossover

Join Crossover and you’ll be given the responsibility of combining the art of design with the art of programming. You will be implementing, iterating or even completely revamping the front-end code of a number of applications to be based on today’s modern JS frameworks. You should have an unrelenting drive for quality, with a passion for responsive UIs with tight animations. You will work closely with a global team of developers in utilizing the best-in-practice architecture, tools, and design patterns in web development. And most importantly, you will be expected to demonstrate a deep understanding on how to build custom web applications (including animations) by leveraging backend REST services through the use of data driven JS frameworks.

Compensation

At Crossover, you’ll earn extremely competitive wages while enjoying the flexibility of working from virtually anywhere on the face of the earth:

  • Salary: 30 USD/hr

  • Position type: Full time (40 hours per week)

  • Location: Global

item.title: Node.js Full Stack Developer x 2 - join us at SuperAwesome! at SuperAwesome (London, UK)
item.description:
(If you read just one job advertisement this year, please read this one – it’s super awesome!)



About SuperAwesome



  • We’re passionate about leveraging new tech. We’re one of the biggest users of Docker in London and huge advocates of Node.js, Angular.js and AWS.

  • We started in 2013. There’s now 65 of us across 5 offices worldwide (and we’re not slowing down)!

  • The Internet was built by adults, for adults. Our mission is to build the infrastructure for a better Internet for kids, empowering an entire generation to engage online in a safe way (something that really has been neglected over the years). This really matters to us!

  • We’re the only company in the world with a COPPA certified marketing platform

  • What we’re doing is massively complex and challenging. Our platform reaches over 255 million kids globally each month.

  • We’re well funded. Our superb entrepreneurial leadership team secured another $7m of funding in the summer.

  • We’re looking for two truly passionate Node.js Full Stack Developers to join our tech team of 20 in our beautiful offices in Covent Garden, London - directly above the tube station!



Why we’re different



  • From day 1 you’ll take full ownership of the products you develop, with access to our live platform (with no micro-management).

  • You’ll make a significant impact on an entire generation of kids coming online.

  • You’ll be given as much responsibility as you can carry.

  • If you’re proactive, you can really expand your knowledge, role and responsibilities very quickly. We’re always encouraging those who can develop and grow in their role!

  • You’ll join a really passionate culture who’s daily mantra is: “We get sh*t done – together”.

  • You’ll join a team that has a healthy disregard for the impossible.



What you’ll do with us



  • You’ll work with tons of autonomy to solve problems across our full stack

  • You’ll get to work from specification to final product with minimal intervention

  • You’ll join us in our Lean and Agile approach with our daily stand-ups and two week sprint cycles. You might choose to attack some problems in a pair programming session, or equally on your own - it’s up to you!

  • You’ll follow our rapid deployment process, where we deploy new code over 10 times per day using some of the world’s leading technologies (e.g. AWS and Docker).

item.title: Full Stack Java Developer at Nuxeo (Paris, France)
item.description:
You will be part of our talented team of developers working across all aspects of the Nuxeo Platform and its associated products. This is a position that will use current and modern development technologies so coding skills matter (front-end, back-end core services, build & packaging, continuous integration, etc.). At Nuxeo developing software is at the very core of our company.


This means that developers who integrate with our existing development teams are people who:



  • Code because they love coding – you don’t just code because you are too young to be a project manager!

  • Commit to the full development cycle (design + coding + test + packaging + delivery)

  • Care about doing things the right way – we sell support and maintenance so quality really matters.

  • Like communicating about what we do: blog posts, conferences, etc.


Our technical stack:



  • Java for the server side: OSGi like framework with extension points and service patterns

  • JavaScript for the client side: jQuery, Polymer (Web Components), AngularJS

  • OSGi, CDI, JAX-RS

  • JSF, GWT

  • Redis, Elasticsearch

  • AWS

  • Maven, Ansible

  • JUnit + custom test runner

  • WebDriver and Selenium

  • Sonar, Nexus and Jenkins

  • NoSQL / MongoDB


Occasionally (<10% of your time) you will meet with our customers to share your expertise on specific modules of the platform.

Intelliware is looking for full stack software developers to join our dev team. If you’re looking to work on everything from front-end to server-side code and database architecture, we’d love to hear from you.


At Intelliware you’ll have the opportunity to be part of a top-notch team and work on a wide range of complex projects. We have a unique team-based Agile environment with collaborative project rooms where you’ll find continuous learning opportunities and challenging work. Project teams work closely with client subject matter experts, end users and IT teams to deliver anything from proof-of-concept prototypes to bulletproof, long living, high volume production applications.


While working within a team in an Agile environment, you will be:



  • Designing high quality applications that are highly scalable and extensible

  • Estimating, tasking and prototyping

  • Contributing clear and maintainable code to a shared codebase

  • Collaborating with cross-functional team members on features, design and implementation

  • Investigating, learning and applying new technologies/processes

  • Clarifying requirements with team and client representatives


Intelliware’s niche is delivering mission critical software applications for complex business or technical challenges. The nature of our work allows project teams the opportunity to work with a wide variety of technologies although our core development is in Java and JavaScript. Recent projects we’ve delivered include technologies such as: AngularJS, jQuery, Meteor, Node.js, MongoDB, Apache Wicket, Spring Batch, Spring Data JPA and Hibernate.

item.description:
As a Senior or Mid-Level UI Engineer in Product Research you will discover new and innovative ways to empower consumers to love their takeaway experience across our 15 countries.


As an Engineer in Product Research what will you be doing?:



  • Working in a small team that believes a few passionate people can have a big impact. Think of us as a lean startup disrupting from within.

item.title: Senior Developer for Azure based application at SolarWinds (Brno, Czech Republic)

item.title: Dev engineer - Global digital channels space - Java, Spring, Javascript, Angular at ING (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
ING is looking for an experienced (mid-senior level) Dev engineer to strengthen its development team that delivers complex mission-critical software solutions for the Global digital channels space.


If you want to work at a place where we care about scoring high on The Joel Test, where we believe that you can live by the agile manifesto without jeopardizing the necessary compliance and QA measures, where we find that the problem chooses the language/technology and not the other way around, where we are committed to fostering a proper engineering culture and building a high-productivity team of smart Dev engineers with the getting-things done mentality, please read on.


Job Description Your main focus will be on building ING’s:



  • New multi-product and multi-country ING Commercial Banking Portal, which gives clients integrated access to Commercial Banking products and services.

  • Access and Identity management solutions utilized across all online channels of ING Commercial Banking including the new ING Commercial Banking Portal.

  • Other in-house software solutions in response to business needs.

  • In addition to developing complex software solutions, you will also contribute to:

  • Streamlining our development process all the way from code check-ins to deployment into production in collaboration with Ops colleagues (using the best tools that we can find: e.g. Jira, git, Jenkins, Maven, Artifactory, …).

  • Improving our continuous integration, increasing our automated test coverage, and helping us get to the next level of maturity with respect to Continuous Delivery.


Your work environment


You will work in the dynamic and challenging environment of the IT organization of ING Global Digital Channels. We operate according to a Scrum Agile development process and strongly believe in the DevOps approach to delivering IT solutions. The focus is on high-quality mission-critical software delivered in time using iterative development with regular milestone demos to the business, so that at the end there are no surprises about what we build.

item.title: Senior Frontend Developer at HelloFresh (Berlin, Germany)

Our growth trajectory and expansion has been phenomenal – only 3 years after inception we are active in 7 markets on 3 continents, all of which are managed and maintained from our global headquarters in Berlin.


We aim to revolutionize the way we eat by making it more convenient and exciting to cook meals from scratch at home. We have received almost US$ 280mn in venture capital and have won multiple prizes for our work. Our team is diverse, high-performing and international, helping us to create a truly inspiring work environment in which you will thrive!
