item.title: Front-end developer at Volumental (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
Volumental is building a world that fits you, where all products and services are customized to your body shape. Through changing how the world designs, manufactures, buys and sells products, we minimize returns, transform production and reduce waste. We enable artisans, and make people happier through putting the individual in the center of product creation. We are a diverse and supportive team passionate about making the fashion and retail industry more sustainable (see more at About Volumental).


You will be part of a small and fast growing web team that's creating the digital infrastructure for this custom future, working closely with our algorithm developers and product team as well as consultants.


As part of the web team at Volumental, you’ll be designing interfaces and concepts we will scale to millions of users (one of the benefits of a fast-growing startup!). You will solve challenging and fun problems like how to show, interact and visualize complex data showing additional value of scanning your body than just being able to eliminate sizes. You’re highly encouraged to spend time, attend courses and conferences to develop new skills and excel at these tasks.

item.title: CTO | Chief Technology Officer at SpotMe (Lausanne, Switzerland)
item.description:
As we continue to grow aggressively across continents, we are seeking a hands-on leader who can take the product organization to the next level. As a CTO you will report directly to the Group Executive Board and must enjoy the challenge of working with a global team of engineers in Europe, US, and in our near-shore development center. You are great at building relationships amongst the team and foster a collaborative environment. You must enjoy spending time with customers to understand their needs and deliver innovative solutions for the broad market. You have experience with building a high-performing product organization delivering high-quality software using a formal methodology, and you understand every aspect of the product in a SaaS environment. The CTO will need to be a global leader and will travel extensively. The position is open in Lausanne, Switzerland.


Key Responsibilities



  • Lead, grow, support and mentor the engineering and support teams for all aspects of product and service development (Design, Architecture, Development, DevOps, IT Operations, QA, Documentation)

  • Full P&L responsibility for the SpotMe Technologies organization

  • Lead the Product Development processes, in tight collaboration with the regional management, event production team, customer success team, support, sales and marketing

  • Oversee the architecture of the SpotMe technology globally 

  • Oversee workload and priority for the team, and be an individual contributor at least on a part-time basis

  • Actively participate and engage with current and future potential technology partners

item.title: Web-Entwickler (m/w) at sofatutor GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Das sofatutor-Prinzip


Wir bauen ein ganz besonderes Produkt, welches es Schülern ermöglicht, genauso einfach und flexibel zu lernen, wie das heute in anderen Bereichen schon längst üblich ist. E-Learning bekommt bei sofatutor eine komplett neue Bedeutung, weil auch Schule mit uns easy, spaßig und effizient wird. Dazu arbeiten wir mit einem Tüftler-Team in unterschiedlichen Konstellationen zusammen. Egal ob an der selbstgebauten Müslibar, bei einem Kaffee in der Küche oder bei einer Pizza nach Feierabend: Wir tauschen uns ständig aus, um die aktuellen Trends im Learning-Bereich für unser Produkt nutzbar zu machen. Als Web-Entwickler (m/w) ist deine Kernaufgabe die Umsetzung und Optimierung von Features auf unserer einzigartigen Plattform.


Deine Mission


Gemeinsam mit unserem Tech-Team baust du Antworten für noch nie dagewesene Anforderungen. Unser Ziel – sofatutor zum umfassenden Lernbegleiter zu etablieren – verlierst du nicht aus den Augen, wenn du die unterschiedlichen Ansprüche an das Produkt umsetzt. Dazu gehören folgende Tasks:



  • Umsetzung von Features in Ruby on Rails aufgrund von unterschiedlichen Anforderungen, die aus unserem Team kommen

  • Umsetzung des Frontends neuer Features unserer bestehenden Ruby on Rails-Applikation in HTML/CSS und JavaScript bzw. mit Haml, Sass und CoffeeScript

  • Eigenständige Ressourcen- und Projektplanung

  • Abschätzung von Aufwänden eigener Projekte und Tasks


Unser Versprechen


Wir geben dir die Unterstützung, die du zur Umsetzung komplexer Anforderungen brauchst. Zusätzlich versprechen wir dir, dass du genug Zeit zum Lernen und Optimieren hast, damit du stets auf dem neusten Stand bist. Die anderen in deinem Team schwärmen von folgenden weiteren Benefits:



  • Kurze und effiziente Entscheidungswege, die uns ermöglichen, agil auf neue Herausforderungen zu reagieren.

  • Ein begeisterungsfähiges Team, das regelmäßig zusammenkommt und immer offen für innovative Ideen ist.

  • Eine ausgewogene Balance des verantwortungsvollen Jobs und genügen Zeit für dich persönlich.

  • Sportkurse, die einen idealen Ausgleich zum Büroalltag bieten.

  • Eine Reihe an Teamevents, die vom tropischen Badespaß bis zum winterlichen Rodeln alles bereit halten.

  • Einen professionellen Austausch unter Kollegen. Und für den seltenen Fall, dass wir intern den Experten nicht parat haben, holen wir uns die Fachleute einfach ins Haus.

item.title: Senior or Principal Engineer - Partner Product Development (NEW TEAM) at JUST EAT (London, UK)
item.description:
As a Senior or Principal Engineer at JUST EAT you will work on a product that generated over £1billion worth of orders in 2014, but wait... It's still growing!? 


As an Engineer in Partner Product Development what will you be doing?:



  • Our new global PPD team builds cutting edge software and devices used by over 45700 restaurant partners across the UK, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, Spain, Ireland, Italy, Netherlands and Norway.

  • Working in Continuous Delivery / Deployment and having full stack control to meet your's and your teams objectives.

  • Using OKR's to be aligned with company wide objectives, and create great clarity about what will make the boat go faster!


If you are a Senior Engineer you will:



  • Will become a trusted technical authority and specialist in one or more technical areas of your team. You’ll be someone the rest of the team and your Technology Manager can turn to for engineering advice and guidance.

  • Collaborate with other product development teams and use their feedback as a basis for improvements.

  • Write technically sound, clean, maintainable code – with practical application of established patterns and practices.


If you are a Principal Engineer you will:



  • Will be a trusted technical authority; someone we can turn to for reliable, concise engineering advice and guidance.

  • Take technical ownership of your team’s work, from its infancy through to delivering production ready software that pushes our standards ever higher.

  • Ensure the Technology department as a whole continuously improves, by proposing and implementing new processes, designs and engineering practices that makes your team more effective; and then use your influence, and the respect others have for you, to have these processes implemented more widely across other teams.

  • Evangelise the technical work of your team to the wider community outside JUST EAT.

item.title: Senior Developer - Front End - $40/hr, 100% remote position at Crossover (Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam) (allows remote)
item.description:
"

Ready to make $80,000 and eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you. Youll earn the most competitive wages on the market, collaborate with the most skilled teams in your field, and work for the most elite companies in the world. Sound too good to be true? Take a closer look


Youll be given the responsibility of combining the art of design with the art of programming. You will be implementing, iterating or even completely revamping the front-end code of a number of applications to be based on todays modern JS frameworks. You should have an unrelenting drive for quality, with a passion for responsive UIs with tight animations. You will work closely with a global team of developers in utilizing the best-in-practice architecture, tools, and design patterns in web development. Most importantly, you will be expected to demonstrate a deep understanding on how to build custom web applications (including animations) by leveraging backend REST services through the use of data driven JS frameworks.


Crossover is partnering with the hiring company to fill this position. Crossover specializes in finding and managing the talent in todays global workforce and will help you through the recruiting process.

The hiring company is probably the worlds first software factory. They are disrupting the way enterprise software is created by adopting a factory-style model for development and delivery. It has been built ground up on the basis of innovative processes and tools that are their Intellectual Property (IP). They manage massive scale, yet provide great cost savings and high quality in their work. This is, by the way, the complete opposite of conventional software development, where scale often leads to quality issues, cost and time overruns.

"

a10:author.a10:name: ubitricity Gesellschaft für verteilte Energiesysteme mbH

item.title: Senior Frontend Developer at ubitricity Gesellschaft für verteilte Energiesysteme mbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Your Chance


You develop, implement, and integrate value-added services, data analytics, and features for billing and analyzing EV charging transactions.


Web portal and app are our faces to the world. Make them stunning and a pleasure to use. Take on the responsibility for development and operations of our Ruby-on-Rails frontend that sits atop a Java core. Add features, improve usability, and scale the portal to support a growing customer base.


The frontend of our internal enterprise systems should not be dull and boring. Make our operations staff happy by providing them great user experience, enhanced process automation and guidance.


Cooperate with our operations and backend teams and build a unified interface for operations processes and our core business technology. Enhance our understanding of charging data through insightful analytics and visualization.


Our Offer



  • Create and grow: You shape the course of your work and of the entire company. Expand your horizon and learn about the integration of mobility, energy, and e-commerce.



  • Challenging Tasks: You shape the green-field development of customer-facing and operations frontends. Your ideas are the face of ubitricity.



  • Team Spirit: We are skilled, professional and dynamic, from diverse backgrounds, and cover the entire value chain.



  • Future-proof: Let’s revolutionize mobility and energy supply together - let’s shape an industry in its infancy!



  • Innovative Workplace: Here at the EUREF-Campus, experience e-mobility and smart grid integration first hand, in the middle of Europe’s startup capital.

item.title: Greenfield Projects - Software Engineer at Cake Solutions Ltd (Stockport, UK)
item.description:
At Cake Solutions we work with our customers to build high-quality, scalable and resilient software systems using the latest technology. As a software engineer, you'll not only be able to write good, maintainable software, but also stay at the forefront of technology and advocate a principled approach to software engineering. You'll get the opportunity to work on a wide range of interesting projects for our clients, using Java, Scala, Play, and Akka.


What to expect:


To begin with, you will take part in a 2 week Typesafe certified workshop style training course where you will get introduced to Scala, Akka and Play.


You can expect a lively and challenging environment with very interesting problems to solve. We are happy to train and mentor the right people; the important thing is to have a bright mind and the motivation to question, explore and learn. Having published work, on Github or elsewhere, is extremely helpful. CVs should focus on what you really know, not what you've seen once.


You will also get flexible working hours and gym membership.

item.title: Infrastructure Engineer / Developer at PrismFP (London, UK)
item.description:
Position Summary


PrismFP is a boutique investment brokerage based in central London – we are putting in place ground-breaking ideas for global markets and asset management. Our team is responsible for building analytical and execution software using cutting edge open source technologies and Agile development practices.


We are looking to hire a person with a DevOps/Sysadmin background, who is looking for an opportunity to grow as a developer and keen to learn about the financial services industry.

item.title: Front End Software Engineer at McLaren Applied Technologies (Woking, UK)
item.description:
Front end software engineers at McLaren Applied Technologies create innovative solutions using the latest open source technologies. We need smart engineers who are passionate about technology to join our team and help us provide timely insight into data for our customers. Your technical expertise will help us design, develop, test, deploy, and enhance software solutions that display and analyze data quickly and efficiently. You could be writing a web application with AngularJS or a desktop application with Electron.


Responsibilities:



  • Create efficient and reusable front-end solutions.

  • Develop small prototypes and spikes that reduce risk.

  • Actively contribute to agile ceremonies.

item.title: Software Engineer at CollegeNET (Portland, OR)
item.description: Our group builds and enhances innovative services for higher education in a collaborative environment.

item.title: Lead Java Engineer at Capital One (Nottingham, UK)
item.description:
We’re one of the UK’s leading credit card companies. We put customers first – and we pride ourselves on innovation. Our brand new purpose built UK Software Studio will house a small group of agile teams and they will play an integral role in delivering ground-breaking digital solutions and we’d like you to be part of it.  


A software engineering role at Capital One isn’t about automating or digitising what we currently have.  We’re looking for you to disrupt the financial services industry by reimagining what financial services could be, by creating new, innovative products and solutions that will make our customers lives easier.


As a member of one of our scrum teams, working alongside other super-talented software engineers, you will be delivering user stories and features relating to API development, REST services, setting up CI/CD, traditional web-app development tasks or perhaps cutting your teeth in angular JS or such (if you haven’t already) and much more as we strive for cross functional and self organising teams. Through communities of practise, outside your feature team, you’ll contribute to the wider coding community, ensuring that products are built in line with architectural patterns and coding standards, and perhaps helping to mature TDD as part of our daily life. Working with product owners, architects and others to identify technical and functional system needs and creative problem solving will also be part of your day-to-day role. With this in mind, you’ll need to be a genuine people person who works well in a fast-moving environment.


Whilst our tools, techniques and languages are ever changing as we disrupt and adapt to our customer needs, the current platforms and technologies are: Enterprise Java, Scrum, Kanban, IntelliJ, Tomcat, JSON, AJAX, Jenkins, Gradle, Cucumber, Apache WS, service development including REST & SOAP, AngularJS, CSS, HTML, Linux, Secure programming practises, TDD. Bring us all this – and more besides – and we’ll make sure you’re handsomely rewarded. As well as a pension scheme, bonus, generous holiday entitlement and private medical insurance, you can look forward to a host of useful benefits. Relocation assistance, while not guaranteed, may be available for exceptional candidates. 


Minimum Qualifications:
- A Levels or equivalent experience
- Expertise in software development

Preferred Qualifications:
- Graduate Degree


Capital One is committed to diversity in the workplace.

item.title: Frontend Developer - ReactJS at Reach7 (London, UK)
item.description:
We’re Reach7 and we are helping to make the world smaller by removing language barriers and connecting people on a global scale via technology and social. We’re based in London, a city where multiculturalism is the norm and we’re taking our learnings to help individuals and businesses reach out to everyone across the globe no matter where they are based or what language they speak making us a technology company with a global voice.



Our technology stack is bleeding edge and we are not afraid to experiment and are quick to implement ideas from all our developers.



For this role, we are looking for someone who has a number of years experience in frontend Javascript development, ideally with frameworks such as Backbone.js or AngularJS. You will have recently developed an interest in React.js and started developing with it either professionally or on side projects. You should also know, or have a keen interest to learn Node.JS.

item.title: Engineering Interns - Python and/or MEAN stack / AngularJS at Stratagem Technologies Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
Stratagem Technologies is an established sports betting technology startup looking for an innovative engineering intern to work with our engineering team in one of two roles: backend Python development for our automated trading and smart execution system or full-stack cutting edge web development using the MEAN stack / AngularJS.


Our trading system and smart execution engine allow us to create automated statistical strategies involving sports bets. Our trading system stack involves Python and various databases including Cassandra, mongodb, Redis and message queue RabbitMQ. Our cloud platform, StrataBet is a one-stop portal for all things sports betting, and currently has professional analysis, models, and execution capabilities for football with Tennis in development. Our StrataBet stack involves a static AngularJS frontend and Golang API backends. (Golang can be learned upon hire.)  You will ideally have experience with using Python in computationally intensive statistical / data science applications or developing web platforms using AngularJS. Some experience with big data ideal but not required.


These projects are at the core of what we at Stratagem work with and are integral to our company. We are a growing and innovative technology company at the intersection of finance and sports betting. You will be smart and able to get stuff done, but you'll also want to contribute ideas and expand horizons.


We don't score 12 on the Joel Test right now, but we aspire to, and we want to find someone who will help us move in that direction. Joining a startup, this is your chance to get in early and make your mark. You'll have autonomy to make decisions and to work how you want to work, allowing you to deliver results as efficiently as possible. Want to explore new technologies? No Problem. Want to learn new skills? Even Better. We want you to be hungry to push the horizons ­ both ours and yours.

item.title: Data Analytics Engineer at Sharethrough (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Sharethrough is looking for engineers interested in building data products and infrastructure to power our business and provide insight to our customers.  You'll be taking the lead on the design and implementation of a data warehousing infrastructure used by our product, engineering and operational teams.


What You'll Be Doing:



  • Greenfield architecture and construction of a modern data warehouse

  • Working with new technologies such as Apache Spark and Amazon Redshift

  • Deriving insight from large quantities of data, starting with our 500GB/day performance pipeline

  • Collaborating with data science and business intelligence teams on visualization and data wrangling platforms such as Looker


Let’s talk if...



  • You’ve got experience with SQL, ETL, python/shell scripting, and MPP Data Warehousing

  • You’ve worked on or are interested in data integrity governance and semantic layer design

  • You possess an intense curiosity about data and a strong commitment to practical problem solving

item.title: Senior Frontend Engineer at Zalando SE (Hamburg, Germany)
item.description:
• Development of scalable, high performance web applications with Ember.js and a modern web-stack (CSS3, HTML5, WebSockets, etc.).

  • Performance monitoring and ensuring a seamless user experience, while maintaining continual improvement efforts.

  • Design and implement automated-testing (BDD, acceptance, CSS regression testing).

item.title: Java Developer at William Hill (Leeds, UK)
item.description:
Are you a Java Developer that would like to lead technology innovation in online and mobile betting and gaming? Our site gets 3 million hits a day and our apps have had over 2 million downloads, allowing our customers to buy 9000 times per minute! You could be the one developing new applications and features for our site or developing our Global Trading Platform that provides the central nervous system of our business, delivering accurate, aggregated, actionable, real-time market information to our team around the world.


Working in a dedicated delivery cell in either Leeds or London, using Agile principles with a mix of SCRUM, Kanban and Lean practices you will help us deliver new products with the latest technologies to our customers.

item.title: C# MVC Developer - Exciting Agile Greenfield Projects at Civica (Leeds, UK)
item.description:
Civica are seeking talented C# ASP.NET MVC developers to work on a number of Greenfield Web based applications projects in our Leeds office You'll join a vibrant development team, Designing solutions, writing code and making improvements to the way we build our software.


Why Join us:



  • Opportunity to Develop Greenfield project based applications

  • Input into Technology you use - MVC, Web API, Angular JF, HTML v5,

  • Excellent Development practices - Agile, Sprint Planning, Daily Scrums, Story Points, Daily Stand Ups, Behaviour Driven development,

  • Participate in the full development process, contributing to sprint planning meetings, design and code reviews and retrospectives.

  • Relaxed Working Environment

item.title: Ambitious, Creative, Front End Web Developer at Tutch Media Ltd (Aston, UK)
item.description:
They say you can't buy great taste, but we believe that you can demonstrate great taste by design. We're looking for someone who has a passion for stunning and seamlessly functional user interfaces, someone who loves getting things done, and when asked "can we do this for our client?", rather than taking a deep breath through gritted teeth like a plumber costing a job, they say yes I can do that, whilst maintaining their own high standards. 


We're a growing business with ambitions to be the best agency this side of Timbuktu, so we'll support you in your development if you can deliver the goods for our clients.


We offering excellent career prospects, for the right candidate, the chance to work on some really interesting B2C and B2B brands, the opportunity to use your experience and knowledge to influence projects and the chance to work on a wide range of projects in a relaxed and focused working environment. 


As a member of our highly experienced team you will be helping to deliver bleeding-edge solutions for a variety of medium to large sized clients. You will be the conduit between the big ideas of the Creative Team and the end results for our clients.

item.title: Lead Developer (NodeJS) at C8 Management (London, UK)
item.description:
We're looking for a passionate product engineer that maintains an excellent, hands-on knowledge of Node.js, Express, MongoDB in addition to a strategic view across back-end architecture, scalability and security.


Continuous integration, test driven development, and incremental design should be second nature to you; writing code without tests would be unthinkable to you.


Whilst you might not be developing front-end every day, you are keen to explore the evolution of related frameworks such as ReactJS and AngularJS, giving you a solid grasp of their capabilities and enabling you to build a team around this part of the stack.


You have a real passion for software development, having contributed to open-source projects and written or spoken in public about your work. You are an active learner that embraces new technology and development philosophies, and enjoys passing on this knowledge to your team.


Importantly, you are a person that both understands, and enjoys, leading a team of multi-disciplined developers. Leading by example and supporting their growth alongside that of the product.



Prerequisites:



  • An experienced software developer with a track record that includes the successful delivery of a number of consumer facing products and services, at an enterprise level

  • Strong command of the English language (both verbal and written)

item.title: (ReactJS + AngularJS + NodeJS) Developer. Passionate about Javascript? at Sky (Leeds, UK)
item.description: We are not afraid to think differently, we do things exceptionally well, and we don’t do anything small. You will be working with people who have passion and fire in their belly, but people who are also fun and have a good sense of humour. As a Sky employee you are empowered to do what’s right and what’s best for you and your team. We encourage continuous self-development and even have an internal Javascript guild that meets regularly to talk and discuss the latest trends using Javascript. If you are passionate about technology and love working with like-minded people then this will be a great place for you to build your career.

item.title: Senior or Mid-level Front End Developer at Spafax (London, UK)
item.description:
Would you like to spread your wings? Be given responsibility? Take projects by the scruff of the neck? Create new and exciting products which will be used by millions for companies like Lufthansa, British Airways or Emirates Airline?


Are you an experienced Senior Front End Developer who is comfortable with both prototyping and building full products in a no-nonsense rapidly moving environment? Or maybe you are a knowledgeable Mid-level Developer but feel ready to take a step up in your career and take on extra responsibility?


We are seeking a Front End Developer to join our product development team. You will be working work alongside a handful of very skilled developers, in a close-knit fun loving team, to help us build new products and assist with delivering new features and functionality into our existing applications. You will be responsible for creating stunning user interfaces for all of the systems both on desktop and mobile


As a highly experienced, talented and sharp front end developer you will have a strong understanding of JavaScript as well as an all-round development skillset including JQuery, HTML and CSS. You must have an obsessive attention to detail with an eye for visual design and UX.


We see the Senior Developer as someone who takes charge of the entire development initiative from design, through coding, to testing and running the system. They are the shapers, the problem solvers, always craving responsibility, showing experience, commitment and trustworthiness.


We have a broad technology stack, from various JS frameworks (AngularJS, JQuery, Bootstrap and XJS, etc.), ASP .Net MVC, HTML & CSS on the front-end. We use tools which are right for the job, always staying open to new technologies. We believe in automating as much of the development process as possible, building tools to allow developers to focus on doing their job.


*** NO AGENCIES PLEASE ***

item.title: Web Developer - ASP.NET MVC, Web API, Agile, C#, CSS, HTML at Totaljobs Group (London, UK)
item.description:
• Are you a passionate coder with skills in ASP.NET, MVC, C#, Agile, SQL, HTML, JavaScript, JQuery?

  • Keen to work with some of the latest technologies, practices & techniques?

  • Want to join the UK’s largest & fastest growing online recruitment advertising business?

    • A company that has been voted one of the top companies to work for in the UK for the past 8 years running?




If so, please read on!


You & your role;


You’ll be working within one of our dedicated scrum teams, amongst other highly talent Developers, QA’s, BA’s and Scrum Masters.


You’ll undertake a hands on role, joining a team of smart, motivated Developers whom work within a full agile and scrum environment, helping candidates find jobs they love and helping companies recruit great talent, like you!


The ideal candidate will have a mixture of both back end and front end web development experience gained using a range of .Net related technologies gained within an Agile/Scrum environment.


We’re based on the Southbank in the fantastic Blue Fin Building, with great transport links and brilliant facilities including a subsidised canteen, a gym and a 10th floor roof terrace.


For a full list of technologies tools and practices we use, plus an insight into our development culture please visit our tech blog: http://www.tjgtechblog.com/


About us;


Established since 1999, the Totaljobs Group is the UK’s largest & fastest growing online recruitment advertising business. We’re owned by the StepStone Group, an internationally successful job board business that operates in over 22 countries.


We have 450 employees across the UK and a fast paced, exciting, innovative culture.


As employers we value talent, integrity, innovation and results whilst respecting our employee’s work-life balance, freedom and appetite for challenge and recognition, which is why we have been voted one of the top companies to work for in the UK, 8 years running!


Some of your responsibilities as a Developer @ TJG;



  • Full stack development – from using front end technologies like AngularJS to database technologies such as DynamoDB, SQL Server and everything in between – MVC, Web API, WCF, C#

  • Present interesting technologies tools and practices back to the department via brown bags and communities of practice meetups

  • Work alongside dedicated Scrum Master, BA, QA and 3 other developers in a cross-skill team to develop and deliver high quality code in lightning fast time

  • Using XP practices such as pair programming TDD and its variants to develop high quality maintainable code

  • Feed into departmental engineering strategy and platform improvement backlog

  • Feed into our Tech Radar that guides which technologies tools and practices that we should trial, assess, adopt or hold

  • Refactor and iteratively upgrade older parts of the platform to use the latest tech and design patterns while still delivering business value


Your ideal skills & attributes;



  • Super interested in all things technical

  • Willing to participate in technical discussion(s)

  • Committed to producing highly valued code quality maintainability and reliability

  • Previous experience of collaborating with a wide group of stakeholders


Ideally, you’ll have as much experience with as many of the following technologies;



  • ASP.Net MVC, Web API

  • HTML/CSS (bootstrap, LESS)

  • JavaScript (jQuery, AngularJS)

  • SQL Server

  • Octopus Deploy

  • TeamCity


Totaljobs Group Generous Benefits Package includes:



  • 35 hour working week; Monday to Friday 9am – 5pm

  • 29 Days Holiday plus bank holidays

  • Group Pension Scheme

  • Life Cover x 4 basic annual salary

  • 2 paid charity days per year

  • Employee Assistance Programme

  • Cycle to Work Scheme

  • Free Eye Tests

  • Season Ticket Loan (after probation)

  • Childcare Allowance (after probation)

  • Up to 6 free Physio Sessions (after probation)

  • Excellent Maternity & Paternity Pay/Leave


Please ensure your eligibility to work in the UK before applying.

item.title: Senior Backend Developer - GO and/or Python (m/f) at NewStore (Berlin, Germany)

You will lead efforts to optimize application performance and remove bottlenecks with PostgreSQL. You will be writing scalable code and working with product architect to determine the architectural design. You will work in a team that values innovation, clean code and cross-functionally.

item.title: Technical Developer at Cymba Integrated Solutions Ltd (Maidenhead, UK)

The role is broad, encompassing development of completely new products, maintenance and administration of existing systems, and providing tech support on both an internal and client-facing basis.

item.title: Anwendungsentwickler/-in Perl und Typescript/Javascript at MCL Computer & Zubehör GmbH (Böblingen, Deutschland) (allows remote)
item.description:
Ihre Aufgaben

item.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer, Cloud at Sophos (Burlington, MA)
item.description:
SENIOR FULL STACK DEVELOPER



At Sophos, we operate at the cutting edge of technology, protecting businesses worldwide against complex threats, viruses and spam. We build high quality software security products in a fast-paced, nimble environment and we've been doing it for over 20 years.


Join us to help our customers protect their business and meet compliance needs.


Role


Senior Software Engineers possess the ability to function as a technical lead, providing technical direction to other developers. Frequently have direct responsibility for product features or key technology choices and implementation. Collaborates as part of a team for the development of complex systems; including requirements analysis, concept development and design, implementation and testing, demonstrating flexibility of role as required.



  • Candidates located in other areas of MA & NH are also welcome to apply


Main Duties



  • Drive design and implementation leveraging modern design patterns

  • Ability to partner effectively with UX, PM, DevOps, QE and other developers to design and implement meeting the spirit of requirements

  • Pride in authorship of code

  • Experience in modern front end frameworks

  • Technically curious to keep present on advances in technology

  • Experience with segregation of model, presentation, and business logic.

  • TDD experience and strong desire to build in test from the start.

  • Write code (Test or Product) to deliver against project timescales, quality and requirements in various languages including Java or other selected languages for Sophos Cloud products.

  • Conduct Unit, System and Integration testing and fixing errors, with guidance if required.

  • Work with best of breed Cloud technologies (NoSQL, high throughput event processing, cloud-scale data analytics, etc)

  • Design small software components (Functionality, defect fixes or automation) that form part of a larger solution, in line with team objectives

  • Define Test scenarios and Test cases to ensure quality of the teams deliverables

  • Provide guidance and mentorship to junior developers in daily Scrum meetings.


Experience and Skills



  • BS in Computer Science or equivalent

  • 7+ years of JAVA, API, JavaScript, Angular JS, Java Web Services, UI Skills, Json.

  • Experience using and creating RESTful APIs.

  • Experience with the following technologies (recommended);

    - MongoDB
    - Redis

  • Experience/knowledge with CI/CD

  • Experience with Agile Software Development methodologies

  • Excellent attention to detail

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills


Essential



  • Design and write high quality code

  • Evaluation of code and design quality

  • Understands how products and technologies interface with each other and fit with the strategy and business needs

  • Evaluation of technical and functional specifications and their cohesion

  • Negotiation

  • Technical problem solving

  • Effective communication with different types of audience

  • Risks Assessment and Mitigation

  • Coaching and training

  • Team Working


Benefits


In most cases, the compensation package includes:



  • Medical insurance

  • Dental insurance

  • Vision insurance

  • Life insurance

  • Long-term disability insurance

  • 401k plan

  • Vacation time

  • Gym membership compensation

item.title: Front End Web Developer (Bristol) at Potato (Bristol, UK)
item.description:
We're looking for front end developers to join us in our office in central Bristol, developing web tools and apps for huge audiences. Our clients include Google, YouTube, Skype, PayPal and other agencies such as BBH and Mother.


This role will see you leading the technical aspects of a project with our friendly, expert team. The workload will sometimes be hectic, but the atmosphere is cheerful and proactive. We want to put you and your team in a position to write and deploy the best code that you can.


There are plenty of technical acronyms in here, but fundamentally we're looking for intelligent people who have an eagerness to learn new things, and the communication skills to be able to explain them to humans such as project managers and our clients.


As well as the technical knowledge, we need people that get it - people who can figure things out by themselves but know when to yell for help. Cutting down and simplifying complex problems with interfaces which make them appear straightforward.



You should probably know about...



  • Architecting and developing complex JavaScript-powered applications

  • Working closely with backend developers and UX designers

  • Javascript frameworks & libraries such as AngularJS or Backbone.js

  • Semantically marked up HTML

  • CSS, including LESS & SASS

  • git

  • Template engines such as Django, Jinja, or Smarty


We also like talking to people who enjoy...



  • Working in an agency environment

  • JavaScript unit testing tools

  • Development & consumption of HTTP APIs

  • Internationalisation

  • Google Apps & APIs

  • Use of PaaS, such as Google App Engine, Heroku, Elastic Beanstalk, or Windows Azure

  • noSQL & SQL databases


In return you'll get...



  • Free lunch, drinks and snacks

  • A fun and supportive, developer-focussed working environment


Applying


Feel free to apply with a cover letter and CV, but what we would really like to see is some code you've written. A GitHub or Bitbucket URL is ideal. Please let us know whether a freelance or fulltime position is preferable, too.


If we like what we see we'll get back to you quickly to arrange to have a cup of tea and a chat.


jobs+fe-brs@p.ota.to


Agencies:


Please don't call. If (one day) we need you, we'll be in touch.


We will not engage with cold-calling or emailing agencies in any way.

item.title: Django/Python Software Engineer at Tivix, Inc. (London, UK)
item.description:
We're a software consulting firm headquartered in San Francisco (Silicon Valley) with a new office in London. We are a 35-person team, and client roster of leading organizations from around the world. View our website.


We’re looking to add another team member to our team. We do well with people who are smart and take professionalism seriously (but also know how to have fun). People who know how to support your team members and work hard to make clients happy (view our current team).

item.title: Full Stack Developer at Digiterre Agility (London, UK)
item.description:
Digiterre Agility are seeking an experienced full-stack developer to join us as a key contributor to a greenfield web project, built with a React front-end. The back-end is built with C#, relying on Azure Service Bus to manage and process thousands of events per second which are then delivered to the client.


This role will involve working over all parts of the system, so experience with both C# and popular Javascript front-end frameworks is required.


We would expect candidates to have at least 5 years of professional software development experience.

item.title: Software Developer in Hamburg at eSailors IT solutions GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
• Push limits of product innovation and improve this continuously by engaging with the latest advancements in technology and methods

  • Design, develop, test and maintain backend components in distributed backend systems with the focus on high performance and availability

  • Propose and implement ideas and solutions aimed at improving the software quality as well as software architecture of the components and products assigned to the team

  • Work closely with Product Manager, Quality Assurance (QA), UX Design and Service teams in an agile environment to shape new components and products

  • Opportunity to contribute to some of our open-source projects

item.title: Senior or Mid-level Full Stack Software Developer at Spafax (London, UK)
item.description:
Would you like to spread your wings? Be given responsibility? Take projects by the scruff of the neck? Create new and exciting products which will be used by millions for companies like Lufthansa, British Airways or Emirates Airline?


Are you an experienced Senior Full Stack Developer who is comfortable with both prototyping and building full products in a no-nonsense rapidly moving environment? Or maybe you are a knowledgeable Mid-level Developer but feel ready to take a step up in your career and take on extra responsibility?


We are looking for you to come work alongside a handful of very skilled developers, in a close-knit fun loving team, to help us build new products and assist with delivering new features and functionality into our existing applications.


We see the Senior Developer as someone who takes charge of the entire development initiative from design, through coding, to testing and running the system. They are the shapers, the problem solvers, always craving responsibility, showing experience, commitment and trustworthiness.


We have a broad technology stack, from various JS frameworks (AngularJS, JQuery, Bootstrap and XJS, etc.), ASP .Net MVC, HTML & CSS on the front-end, to APIs written in C# (Web API, WCF, etc.) with SQL and NoSQL data stores on the back-end all hosted in the cloud (Azure).


We use tools which are right for the job, always staying open to new technologies. We believe in automating as much of the development process as possible, building tools to allow developers to focus on doing their job.


*** NO AGENCIES PLEASE ***

We are looking to augment a small team (2 developers currently). We are very established with a loyal client base, and keep ourselves at the cutting edge of technology!


WHAT YOU NEED FOR THIS POSITION:

item.title: Develop sites & visualisations to improve data for ending global povertyBristol at Development Initiaitves (Bristol, UK)
item.description:
Web developer, Bristol (initially 12 month contract)


We are looking for a talented developer to help us deliver an ambitious and innovative digital programme. We are globally renowned for our infographics and groundbreaking data visualisation tools, and want you to build on this reputation as we go into 2016 and beyond. You will work alongside passionate colleagues to develop our websites (primarily DI, GHA) and high quality data visualisations (eg Development Data Hub) that engage people working to end poverty. As our only in-house frontend developer, you’ll work closely with colleagues, participating in all stages of the development life cycle from concept planning to delivery.


You’ll sit in both our technical and communications teams and work across all our core programmes, pulling in external support as necessary. You’ll also get involved in consultancy projects for governments and multilateral organisations with global impact via our consultancy arm (DI International).


If you would like to make a positive impact working alongside colleagues committed to ending poverty, we would love to hear from you. Please read the full role profile with details on how to apply at http://devinit.org/working-with-us


Closing date: 18 January 2016


First Interviews: week commencing 1 February 2016


Second Interviews: if necessary, to be advised

This is your opportunity to shape our mobile presence by using state-of-the-art technologies (e.g. Swift 2) within a cross-functional team (UX, Development, Product management in one room).

item.title: (Senior) Java Developer (Big Data) (m/f) (Nuremberg) at GfK SE (Nuremberg, Germany)
item.description:
In our Data & Technology department we are responsible for the complete life cycle of our software products. We develop applications for our internal customers in the fields of market research and big data. In our development process we are working test driven and do continuous integration.


As (Senior) Java Developer in a BigData environment you are part of our department "Panel Operation Development". In a ultra-modern landscape of development, design and analysis tools, we are responsible for the technical design and development of our globally used panel data production system”. In these surroundings you will generate software applications for a new panel data production system by using modern Java frameworks / BigData-technologies such as Java EE, Hibernate, Hadoop and Oozie. Depending on experience in advance you analyze coarse-grained business needs in terms of technical implementation. 


Considering the architectural guidelines you then record technical design decisions based on a functional design. In addition, your daily tasks include the creation of automated unit tests to accompany the implementation and the cooperation with neighboring disciplines, such as functional design, functional testing and operation. After the rollout you resume the analysis and clarification of system problems within the 3rd-Level-Support.

item.title: Software Developer C++ at Bright Computing (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
We have positions available for enthusiastic and experienced software developers for the development of our Linux-based cluster software environment. You will be part of a team responsible for the development of our Linux based cluster management software.


There will be ample opportunity to develop your skills and to take initiative. You will have the opportunity to work with the latest hardware (e.g. GPUs, Xeon Phi and high-speed interconnects such as InfiniBand, Omni Path and 40 Gig-E) and software technologies such as parallel filesystems (e.g. Lustre, GPFS, BeeGFS), Hadoop, Spark, OpenStack, Docker, Kubernetes, Puppet, Open vSwitch and Ceph.


Our development team consists of highly skilled developers that are passionate about building a software product that meets our customers' needs today and in the future. With your help, we will be adding many new features to our product to allow Bright clusters to be used for a wider range of workloads, and to allow clusters to scale to hundreds of thousands of nodes (i.e. exascale). We will also target new CPU architectures such as ARM64 and Power8/9, and further integrate container technology into the product to allow workloads to scale up and down easily on-premise, and to public clouds.

item.title: Scala/Java Developer at eSailors IT solutions GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
Ready to hack your career? Here’s your opportunity. We are looking for fully-fledged software engineers who are obsessed with building resilient, reactive applications using Scala and Java.


It needs to be your obsession, because you will be helping us build back end applications with tough requirements for responsiveness, resilience and reliability whilst handling zero-downtime deployments and highly elastic levels of incoming traffic.


A great challenge, and we have everything in place to support you within our agile ecosystem – an open environment consisting of forward-thinking, self-reliant teams.


Are you also into open-source and as passionate as we are about pair programming, devops, micro-services, brown bag sessions and hackathons? Fantastic. Let’s look at the requirements in detail.


Technologies & Challenges:


- Design, build, test and maintain our advanced Akka and Scala backend applications
- Data modelling and operations for distributed NoSQL databases, in particular Cassandra
- Understand the impact of distributed, clustered applications and databases - Help take care of our continuous integration and continuous delivery pipelines using
- Ansible, Jenkins and Docker
- Build RESTful interfaces using hypermedia and application profiles
- More than a passing familiarity with Linux

item.title: HTML Web Developer with .NET at Prototype Interactive (Dubai, United Arab Emirates)
item.description:
Prototype is growing and looking for an expert HTML/JS/CSS front end web developer with additional experience in .NET, MVC and content management systems.


In your role as web developer you will create custom applications using latest technologies for a broad public audience and some of the most renowned companies in the region. This is a great opportunity to work on exciting projects by joining a team of experts in the field. If you have experience in using LESS, GRUNT, NPM, ANGULAR, GIT, JADE and other latest web technologies then this job is for you.


The projects you'll be working on include complex web portals, single page applications, interactive microsites and real time applications across desktop and mobile devices.


Job Responsibilities



  • Work with Designers and Developers to implement interactive solutions and complex interaction problems using HTML, JavaScript, CSS

  • Transform specifications and mockups into fully functional components and applications

  • Utilize content management systems to build and integrate systems

  • Create hand coded HTML files from provided designs.

  • Experience using rapid prototyping frameworks such as bootstrap, foundation etc.

  • Design and develop new web components from scratch or modify existing ones

  • Analyze current codebase to make recommendations improvements

  • Write code to connect to web services and databases

  • Learn new technologies inside and outside of the .NET domain

  • Positively contributing to the team and clients by mentoring and sharing knowledge

item.title: Senior Software Engineer: Platform / Java at Choose Energy (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
As a Senior Platform Engineer at ChooseEnergy, you can help us disrupt the energy marketplace. In many states (over half the US population), consumers CAN choose their electricity and natural gas supplier, and we're here to help. We can bring renewable energy choices to consumers looking for them and can help people save a lot of money. Until now, no one has attempted to engineer solutions to this hard problem at a national level. Building software that makes the complex simple and does so at scale are critical to allowing us to successfully transform this industry.


We are looking for talented and experienced Senior Java Developer to join our Platform team. Your role will be to design and implement ChooseEnergy APIs which will be widely used by internal and external development teams to build web and mobile applications oriented on both individual users and partners integrations. You will be responsible for designing and developing RESTful APIs coupled with the necessary backend infrastructure required to support these APIs. You will also be responsible for the design and implementation of backend data systems. The ideal candidate should be well rounded, self-motivated, know server side technologies/frameworks, and enjoy fast paced development cycles. A little about our stack: Our web applications are built with Angular.JS and served from our WordPress instance. Our CSS is compiled with SASS. We run our servers on Amazon EC2 using Apache. We build RESTful services using Java, Restlet, Tomcat, MongoDB and MySQL.

item.title: Software Engineer (Scala/Ruby/Java) at M3, Inc. (Tokyo, Japan)
item.description:
As a Software Engineer you’ll be responsible for developing new services for M3's physician and patient users, including projects such as:
- Full system renewal of m3.com Career, Japan's #1 job search site for physicians
- Electronic health record (EHR) development
- Developing authentication and other APIs to enable use of M3's services by 3rd party developers
- Renewal of our largest consumer-oriented service, AskDoctors
We are traditionally a Java shop, but we are proactive about incorporating new technologies into our development process - our main service offering for Japanese physicians is implemented using a microservice architecture and Play 2 / Scala, and we have teams that develop services with the newest Rails / Ruby also. Our business communication is mostly in Japanese, but we are always looking for talented foreigner/expat developers, to increase the international flavor of our Japanese team.


If you’re based in Tokyo already, we’d love to have talk to you over lunch any day, any time. If you’re not based in Japan yet but you’re an outstanding developer with visible accomplishments (i.e. contributions to open source projects, projects on GitHub, etc.), that’s OK too! If you’re the right person, we can help relocate you here, or remote work may also be a possibility.

item.title: Cloud Entwickler (m/w) at ipt Innovation Process Technology (Zürich, Schweiz)
item.description:
ipt ist ein Schweizer IT-Beratungsunternehmen mit über 100 Mitarbeitenden. Leading-edge Technologien sind genauso unser Credo wie eine motivierende Unternehmenskultur. Gemeinsam vor Ort mit unseren Kunden realisieren wir innovative Software-Lösungen für komplexe geschäftliche Herausforderungen.


Wir entwickeln Individualsoftware mit «asset-based Software Solutions» unter Einsatz von führenden Softwareprodukten – mit so wenig Code wie möglich. Unsere vielfältigen Themen sind SOA, ESB, Java EE, BPM, Middleware, Security, Testing, API-Management, DevOps und Cloud Integration.


Was Sie bei uns tun


Sie entwickeln in einem kleinen, schlagkräftigen Projekt-Team innovative Lösungen für unsere Kunden. Sie beraten und begleiten den Kunden durch den ganzen SW-Entwicklungszyklus, vom Requirements Engineering über die Realisierung bis zum Testing und Go-Live. Dank Modellierung und Konfiguration auf modernsten Cloud-Technologien wie ServicNow PaaS oder Dell Boomi iPaaS setzen Sie Business Requirements agil und effizient um. Sie nutzen vorhandene APIs und realisieren neue APIs z.B. für mobile Apps.


Arbeitsort


Unsere Kunden sind grosse Unternehmen mit eigener IT-Abteilung in der Deutschschweiz. Deren Standorte sind schwerpunktmässig im Raum Bern, Basel, Luzern und Zürich. Deshalb ist betreffend Arbeitsplatz Flexibilität gefordert und die Bereitschaft zu pendeln. Dafür fahren Sie 1. Klasse und können auch im Zug arbeiten, solange das Projekt dies ermöglicht.


Einstieg


Der Start bei ipt läuft individuell ab. Gemeinsam definieren wir Themen und Technologien, Sie arbeiten sich selbständig ein. Selbstverständlich unterstützt Sie das ipt-Team und beantwortet gerne Ihre Fragen.


Weiterbildung


«We hire for attitude and we train for skills» ist ein Kernprinzip von ipt. Wir investieren viel in Sie. Deshalb sind Aus- und Weiterbildung für uns sehr wichtig. Wer welche Zertifizierung macht respektive welche Konferenz-Teilnahme sinnvoll ist, wird auf individueller Basis besprochen, ebenso die finanzielle und zeitliche Unterstützung

item.title: Sr. Engineering Manager (CA) at Choose Energy (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Choose Energy is the leading retail energy marketplace where you can shop for electricity and natural gas, and buy the best products for your home and business. With over a billion dollars in transactions, we have already helped homeowners and businesses across the US save millions on their energy bills. We are transforming the $1.5 trillion market that has been around for more than 100 years. Choose Energy is backed by Kleiner Perkins.


As the Sr. Engineering Manager at Choose Energy, you’ll be spearheading the implementation of engineering solutions for unique problems on a national level. You will design and implement APIs that will be used by internal and external development teams to build web and mobile applications oriented on both individual users and partner integrations. You’ll also be responsible for developing the back-end infrastructure required to support these APIs. By combining your deep passion for building software that makes the complex simple with your enthusiasm for growing and nurturing a team, you’ll be contributing daily to our mission to transform the energy marketplace.


A little about our stack: Our web applications are built with AngularJS and our CSS is compiled with SASS. We run our servers on Amazon EC2 using Apache. We build RESTful services using Java, Restlet, Tomcat, MongoDB and MySQL.

item.title: Java Developers to Swedish Online Channels at Swedbank (Vilnius, Lithuania)
item.description:
The Online Channels Vilnius team is a trusted IT partner. Unlike the #InDaBox, our department is wanted, geeky, respectful and with limitless mindset.


Our delivery is visible to 3.8 million Swedish internet bank and 2.5 million Swedish mobile bank customers.


About the job


As a Java Developer you are welcome to join us to:



  • Take part in system design & development

  • Strive for zero bugs in production

  • Participate in peer code reviews & knowledge sharing

  • Promote good ideas and constantly improve your daily work

  • Solve challenging problems and – more importantly – help to avoid them!

  • Work Agile

  • Opportunity to become a full stack developer with tasks ranging from bad margins, to EJB exceptions

item.title: Associate Developer (Java Javascript) Sky Technology Leeds at Sky (Leeds, UK)
item.description:
• You will interpret business requirements and deliver high quality, customer focused technical solutions and implementations meeting and exceeding customer experience and usability requirements.
